channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: FIRE in 2024: What We’d Do Differently If We Started Over Today
item.description: 2013 was a pivotal year for our hosts. Scott was fresh out of college and just beginning his journey to financial independence, while Mindy and her husband were well on […]

item.title: Starpath accelerates moon water mining plans with $12M seed funding
item.description: NASA and the space industry are in agreement: if we want to establish a permanent human presence on the moon, we’ll need to make use of every native resource we can — and none are as important as water ice. Starpath Robotics is one of a handful of startups planning for this future. The startup […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How Prosecutors Fight Exonerations
item.description: As laws are passed to support the wrongfully convicted, some officials in the legal system push back.

item.title: Does the President Have An Impact on Housing? Here’s What 30 Years of Data Says.
item.description: VP Harris just unveiled her economic plan, which included a number of items for supporting the housing market. But does history suggest executive policies make a difference?

item.title: Reliant’s paper-scouring AI takes on science’s data drudgery
item.description: AI models have proven capable of many things, but what tasks do we actually want them doing? Preferably drudgery — and there’s plenty of that in research and academia. Reliant hopes to specialize in the kind of time-consuming data extraction work that’s currently a specialty of tired grad students and interns. “The best thing you […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FAQ: How The Marshall Project Is Covering the 2024 Election
item.description: Learn more about who we are and how we choose what political stories to cover.

item.title: 4 Properties in 4 Years and Saving $40K on ONE Deal by Doing This
item.description: Can rookies find rental properties that cash flow in today’s housing market? Yes! But you may need to get creative. This investor made the numbers work by discovering extra income […]

item.title: Mike Lynch, recently acquitted in HP-Autonomy fraud case, is missing after yacht capsized off Sicily (updated)
item.description: Update: Authorities have yet to access the inside of the sunken yacht, and Mike Lynch is still classified as missing. Other details have emerged in the interim. The accident appears to have been caused by a major storm and a resulting tornado-like water column that ensnared and damaged the yacht. Among the other six people […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Mother on a Mission for Full Police Transparency
item.description: Troy, Alabama, police severely beat Ulysses Wilkerson when he was 17. Seven years later, his mom, Angela Williams, is still fighting for answers.

item.title: 50+ Rentals After Starting in Her 50s and How “Late Starters” Can Get Ahead
item.description: With her retirement dreams on the line, Jill Forsythe had a few choices: return to work, start a business, or get into real estate investing. After trying out more “active […]

item.title: US tech giants fight Indian telcos’ bid to regulate internet services, pay for network usage
item.description: Global technology giants are pushing back against attempts by India’s telecom networks to bring internet services under stricter regulation, rejecting arguments that such measures are necessary to create a “level playing field” and address national security concerns. The Asia Internet Coalition (AIC), a powerful industry body that represents Amazon, Apple, Google, Meta, Microsoft, Netflix and […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How the 1968 DNC in Chicago Devolved into ‘Unrestrained and Indiscriminate Police Violence’
item.description: As protesters prepare for the Democratic National Convention in Chicago next week, a half-century old report provides lessons for preventing chaos.

item.title: Tenants in Big Cities Could Save Thousands if “Broker Fee” Reform Passes
item.description: New “broker fee” reform could help tenants save thousands of dollars when finding their next apartment or home to rent, but it could come at a significant cost to landlords. […]

item.title: Pakistan’s PostEx to enter new markets, starting with Saudi Arabia
item.description: Pakistani startup PostEx is entering Saudi Arabia as first global market after hitting $21 million ARR in the South Asian nation. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Aaron Sankin is The Marshall Project’s new Deputy Data Editor
item.description: Sankin brings deep experience with ambitious data projects.
